page.title: 12CUSTOMS
page.content: Public house games, popular locally are Basket Skittles, said to be against the local bye-laws in Oxon where skittles were banned by Puritans; darts, dominoes, and cribbage, a card game. There are also fruit machines (gambling), and electronic games called 'Space Invaders' fighting games on TV screens. Basket skittles is played on a table padded, to prevent noise, and surrounded by a screen of netting. 9 skittles have to be knocked over with a 'cheese' thrown by the players. 3 throws make one turn. The competition is to knock over the most skittles. LOCAL HISTORY. Aston-le-Walls; Aston stands foe east town. Walls=earth dyke and rampart, which used to run south & west of Aston and C. Warden; ploughed flat in 18th C. Le=Norman clerk's version of the name in Domesday
